explanation.en: Rotate matrix 90 degrees clockwise using transpose and reverse. Step 1: ⍉⍵ transposes the matrix - rows become columns and vice versa. For matrix [[1,2],[3,4]], transpose gives [[1,3],[2,4]]. Step 2: ⌽ reverses each row (applies along last axis). [[1,3],[2,4]] becomes [[3,1],[4,2]]. Combined effect: original position [i,j] moves to position [j, n-1-i] which is exactly a 90° clockwise rotation. Example: [[1,2,3],[4,5,6],[7,8,9]] → [[7,4,1],[8,5,2],[9,6,3]].
